jparsec.model

Class DustOpacity

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.model.DustOpacity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DustOpacity
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A model of dust absorption based on the work by B. T. Draine. For reference see Draine, ApJ 636, 1114-1120 (2006).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • sizeDistributionCoefficient

        public double sizeDistributionCoefficient
        The power law slope of the size distribution, coefficient p of Draine. Typical value is 3.5. dn/da = A * (a/a_max) ^ (-p), where n is the number of grains of a given size, A is a constant, a is the grain radius, and a_max is the maximum size of the grains in the distribution.

      • sizeMax

        public double sizeMax
        Maximum size for the grains in microns. For PAH the maximum allowed value is 0.001 microns, and the minimum is 0.4 nm. For the other grain types the limit is 10000 microns, and the minimum 0.1 microns. For PAH it is not allowed to use sizes greater than 0.001 microns.

      • grainType

        public int grainType
        Selects the type of grains. ID Constants defined in this class.

      • grainDensity

        public double grainDensity
        Sets the density of the grain in g/cm^3. The value can be set to a default one depending on the grain ID.

      • abundanceFraction

        public double abundanceFraction
        Sets the abundance fraction for this grain.

      • GRAIN_ASTRONOMICAL_SILICATE

        public static final int GRAIN_ASTRONOMICAL_SILICATE
        ID constant for astronomical silicate grains. Draine & Lee 1984 and Laor & Draine 1993.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAIN_SMOOTHED_UV_ASTRONOMICAL_SILICATE

        public static final int GRAIN_SMOOTHED_UV_ASTRONOMICAL_SILICATE
        ID constant for smoothed UV astronomical silicate grains. Draine & Lee 1984, Laor & Draine 1993, and Weingartner & Draine 2000.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAIN_GRAPHITE

        public static final int GRAIN_GRAPHITE
        ID constant for graphite grains. Draine & Lee 1984 and Laor & Draine 1993.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAIN_WATER_ICE

        public static final int GRAIN_WATER_ICE
        ID constant for water ice grains. Warren 1984, improved in 1995 by Bo-Cai Gao, Steve Warren, and Warren Wiscombe.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAIN_SILICON_CARBIDE

        public static final int GRAIN_SILICON_CARBIDE
        ID constant for silicon carbide grains. Laor & Draine 1993.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAIN_PAH_CARBONACEOUS_NEUTRAL

        public static final int GRAIN_PAH_CARBONACEOUS_NEUTRAL
        ID constant for PAH neutral grains. Li & Draine 2001.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAIN_PAH_CARBONACEOUS_ION

        public static final int GRAIN_PAH_CARBONACEOUS_ION
        ID constant for PAH ion grains. Li & Draine 2001.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DustOpacity

        public DustOpacity()
        Default constructor;

      • DustOpacity

        public DustOpacity(int type,
           double p,
           double max,
           double abundance)
            throws JPARSECException
        Explicit constructor without density. Density is set to a default value.
        Parameters:
        type - Grain ID constant.
        p - Size distribution, 2.5, 3, or 3.5.
        max - Maximum size, 0.1, 1, ... 10000.
        abundance - Abundance fraction, 0 to 1.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the grain type does not exist.

      • DustOpacity

        public DustOpacity(int type,
           double p,
           double max,
           double density,
           double abundance)
        Explicit constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - Grain ID constant.
        p - Size distribution, 2.5, 3, or 3.5.
        max - Maximum size, 0.1, 1, ... 10000.
        density - Density.
        abundance - Abundance fraction, 0 to 1.

    • Method Detail

      • getRefractiveIndex

        public double[] getRefractiveIndex(double wavelength,
                          java.lang.String fileName)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Gets the refractive index from certain file name. This method is intended to be used with the files contained in the dust jar file.
        Parameters:
        wavelength - Wavelenth in microns, between 0.001 and 1000.
        fileName - Name of the file to read, with extension but without path.
        Returns:
        The real and imaginary parts of the function, in microns.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getRefractiveIndex

        public double[] getRefractiveIndex(double wavelength)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Gets the refractive index for certain grain. Currently unavailable for PAH and graphite.
        Parameters:
        wavelength - Wavelenth in microns, between 0.001 and 1000.
        Returns:
        The real and imaginary parts of the function, in microns.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • solveDustModel

        public static DustOpacity[] solveDustModel(DustOpacity[] dust,
                           double[] waves,
                           int np)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Solves a dust model returning the set of opacities. This method is not recommended due to the high computer time that requires.
        Parameters:
        dust - Dust model consisting of a set of dust opacity intances.
        waves - Set of wavelength in microns.

        Due to computing cost, this method is not recommended. Use values from tabulated tables instead.

        np - Number of points to use when integrating in size. Recommended values are from 500 to 5000 to get an accurate result.
        Returns:
        The dust model.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMieCoefficients

        public double[] getMieCoefficients(double wavelength,
                          int np)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the cross sections for absorption, scattering, and extinction of dust for a given size distribution. An integration is performed from 5E-3 microns up to the given maximum dust radius. This method ussually requires a a lot of computing time.

        For graphite the 1/3-2/3 approximation is used. See Draine and Malhotra 1993.

        Parameters:
        wavelength - Wavelenth in microns, between 0.001 and 1000.
        np - Number of points to use when integrating in size. Recommended values are from 500 to 5000 to get an accurate result.
        Returns:
        Opacity, extinction, scattering, backscattering, mean average of cos(theta). Units are cm^2/g.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • solveDustModelUsingTabulatedValues

        public static DustOpacity[] solveDustModelUsingTabulatedValues(DustOpacity[] dust,
                                               double[] waves,
                                               boolean interpolate)
                                                        throws JPARSECException
        Solves a dust model returning the set of opacities. This method uses tabulated values from tables.
        Parameters:
        dust - Dust model consisting of a set of dust opacity intances.
        waves - Set of wavelength in microns.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Returns:
        The dust model.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • solveDustModelUsingTabulatedValues

        public void solveDustModelUsingTabulatedValues(boolean interpolate)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Solves a dust model returning the set of opacities. This method uses tabulated values from tables, and the default set of wavelengths.
        Parameters:
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • solveDustModelUsingTabulatedValues

        public void solveDustModelUsingTabulatedValues(double[] waves,
                                      boolean interpolate)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Solves a dust model returning the set of opacities. This method uses tabulated values from tables (see getWavelengthsUsingTabulatedValues()).
        Parameters:
        waves - Set of wavelength in microns.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public double getDustModelAtIndex(int index)
        Returns the absorption coefficient for the current instance for a given wavelength index. A previous model should be defined and solved before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the array of wavelengths.
        Returns:
        Dust opacity.

      • getDustModel

        public double[] getDustModel()
        Returns the absorption coefficient for the current instance for all wavelength indexes. A previous model should be defined and solved before calling this method.
        Returns:
        Dust opacities.

      • solveDustModel

        public void solveDustModel(double[] opacities)
        Solves a given dust model by setting the set of opacities. Adequate for tabulated values from tables.
        Parameters:
        opacities - Opacitiy array for a given set of wavelengths.

      • getWavelengthsUsingTabulatedValues

        public double[] getWavelengthsUsingTabulatedValues()
        Obtains the set of wavelengths used to create the tables of opacities and other tabulated values. 100 points in log scale between 0.1 and 1000 microns.
        Returns:
        Set of wavelengths in microns.

      • getAbsorptionCoefficientUsingTabulatedValues

        public double getAbsorptionCoefficientUsingTabulatedValues(double wave,
                                                  boolean interpolate)
                                                    throws JPARSECException
        Gets the absorption coefficient from tabulated tables. The opacity is only available for sizeMax = 0.1, 1, 10, 100, 1000, and 10000 microns. Available values of sizeDistributionCoefficient are 2.5, 3.0, and 3.5. Wavelength should be between 1 and 1000 microns.

        Exceptions: for astronomical silicate the grain maximum size 100000 microns is also available.

        Parameters:
        wave - Wavelength in microns.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Returns:
        Absorption coefficient.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getExtinctionCoefficientUsingTabulatedValues

        public double getExtinctionCoefficientUsingTabulatedValues(double wave,
                                                  boolean interpolate)
                                                    throws JPARSECException
        Gets the extinction coefficient from tabulated tables. The extinction is only available for sizeMax = 0.1, 1, 10, 100, 1000, and 10000 microns. Available values of sizeDistributionCoefficient are 2.5, 3.0, and 3.5. Wavelength should be between 1 and 1000 microns.

        Exceptions: for astronomical silicate the grain maximum size 100000 microns is also available.

        Parameters:
        wave - Wavelength in microns.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Returns:
        Extinction coefficient.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getTabulatedFileName

        public java.lang.String getTabulatedFileName()
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Throws:
        JPARSECException

      • getSpectralIndexUsingTabulatedValues

        public double getSpectralIndexUsingTabulatedValues(double wave,
                                          boolean interpolate)
                                            throws JPARSECException
        Gets the dust spectral index. The opacity is only available for sizeMax = 1, 10, 100, 1000, and 10000 microns. Available values of sizeDistributionCoefficient are 2.5, 3.0, and 3.5. Wavelength should be between 1 and 1000 microns.

        Exceptions: for astronomical silicate the grain maximum size 100000 microns is also available.

        Parameters:
        wave - Wavelength in microns.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Returns:
        Dust spectral index.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getOpacityAndSpectralIndex

        public double[] getOpacityAndSpectralIndex(double wmin,
                                  double wmax,
                                  int np)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Gets the dust opacity and spectral index. Opacity is calculated for both wavelengths provided, while the beta between both wavelengths.
        Parameters:
        wmin - Wavelength in microns.
        wmax - Wavelength in microns.
        np - Number of sizes in the integration. From 500 to 5000 recommended.
        Returns:
        Dust opacity for the first and second wavelengths, and spectral index in the third component.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getOpacityAndBetaCharts

        public CreateChart[] getOpacityAndBetaCharts(double minWave,
                                    double maxWave,
                                    boolean interpolate)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart with the opacity as function of wavelength. Also creates a chart with beta as function of wavelength. Opacities are taken from tabulated tables, so they are only available for certain set of input parameters.
        Parameters:
        minWave - Minimum wavelength for the chart in microns. Equal or greater than 1 microns.
        maxWave - Maximum wavelength for the chart in microns. Equal or lower than 1000 microns.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Returns:
        The opacity and beta charts.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getOpacityAndBetaCharts

        public static CreateChart[] getOpacityAndBetaCharts(DustOpacity dust1,
                                    DustOpacity dust2,
                                    double minWave,
                                    double maxWave,
                                    boolean showMixture,
                                    boolean interpolate)
                                             throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart with the opacity as function of wavelength for 2 grains. Also creates a chart with beta as function of wavelength. Opacities are taken from tabulated tables, so they are only available for certain set of input parameters.
        Parameters:
        dust1 - First dust model.
        dust2 - Second dust model.
        minWave - Minimum wavelength for the chart in microns. Equal or greater than 1 microns.
        maxWave - Maximum wavelength for the chart in microns. Equal or lower than 1000 microns.
        showMixture - True to show also the results for the mixture of grains.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in 3d between the maximum grain size and the grain size distribution slope along all available range of values. If false and the input does not match any of the available values, an error will be produced.
        Returns:
        The opacity and beta charts.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getTotalOpacity

        public static double getTotalOpacity(DustOpacity[] dust,
                     int index,
                     double T)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the total opacity of a given mixture of grains.
        Parameters:
        dust - Array of dust components.
        index - Index of the desired wavelength.
        T - Temperature of the region in K. If the temperature is greater than the dust sublimation temperature (for certain grain type), that grain will not be considered in the calculations.
        Returns:
        The opacity of the mixture, in cm^2/g.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • Hz2micron

        public double Hz2micron(double nu)
        Transforms Hz to microns.
        Parameters:
        nu - Frequency in Hz.
        Returns:
        Wavelength in microns.

      • tranformDustModelToSingleGrain

        public static DustOpacity tranformDustModelToSingleGrain(DustOpacity[] dustModel)
                                                  throws JPARSECException
        Transforms a set of DustOpacity objects into a sole object, equivalent to the corresponding mixture of grains.

        Grain maximum size and size distribution, as well as the size of the array of opacities, are taken from the first element in the mixture. All the elements should have the same grain maximum size, size distribution, and opacities for the same array of wavelengths. Otherwise the mixture will not be suitable for calculations.

        Parameters:
        dustModel - A set of models for a given dust mixture.
        Returns:
        An unique model for the mixture.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getDustModelChart

        public static CreateChart[] getDustModelChart(int grain,
                              int npoints,
                              int np,
                              double wmin,
                              double wmax,
                              boolean max)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the opacity and spectral index charts for a given grain and wavelength. The charts are created for different grain size distribution coefficients and different values of the maximum grain size. This method should be used with caution since it could spend a lot of computing time.

        The maximum wavelength is used for the opacity chart (unless false is given in the max param), while the spectral index is calculated between the minimum and the maximum provided wavelengths.

        Parameters:
        grain - The grain ID constant.
        npoints - The number of points between 1 and 1000 microns to use in the chart.
        np - The number of sizes to integrate.
        wmin - The minimum wavelength for the charts.
        wmax - The maximum wavelength for the charts.
        max - True to use the maximum wavelength for the opacity, false for the minimum wavelength.
        Returns:
        The charts for the opacity and dust spectral index.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getDustModelChart

        public static CreateChart[] getDustModelChart(DustOpacity[] mixture,
                              int npoints,
                              int np,
                              double wmin,
                              double wmax,
                              boolean max)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the opacity and spectral index charts for a given grain mixture and wavelength. The charts are created for different grain size distribution coefficients and different values of the maximum grain size. This method should be used with caution since it could spend a lot of computing time.

        The maximum wavelength is used for the opacity chart (unless false is given in the max param, in that case the minimum wavelength), while the spectral index is calculated between the minimum and the maximum provided wavelengths.

        Parameters:
        mixture - The grain mixture.
        npoints - The number of points between 1 and 10000 microns to use for the grain maximum size.
        np - The number of sizes to integrate.
        wmin - The minimum wavelength for the charts.
        wmax - The maximum wavelength for the charts.
        max - True to use the maximum wavelength for the opacity, false for the minimum wavelength.
        Returns:
        The charts for the opacity and dust spectral index.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getInstanceName

        public java.lang.String getInstanceName()
        Returns the characteristic name of this instance.
        Returns:
        The characteristic name, currently equal to the dust grain name, the max size, the size distribution coefficient, and the relative abundance.

      • getOssenkopfOpacity

        public static double getOssenkopfOpacity(java.lang.String icyMantles,
                         double wave)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Returns the opacity of dust following Ossenkopf and Henning 1994.
        Parameters:
        icyMantles - Type of mantles. Can be 'NORMAL' (default), 'THICK', or 'THIN'.
        wave - Wavelength in microns.
        Returns:
        The opacity of the dust in cm^2/g.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
